image.altText: A collapsed power pole leaning across a road.

props.synopsis: Thousands of homes are without power and ambulances are being diverted from a damaged hospital, as severe winds of more than 100kph batter Tasmania.

title.children: Hospital damaged, power outages for thousands as severe winds smash Tasmania

image.altText: A digital rendering the entrance to a stdium.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's parliamentarians have received a draft version of the order they'll vote on to determine the fate of the Macquarie Point Stadium project.

title.children: A draft order to approve Hobart's stadium has been released. What's in it?

image.altText: Bell Bay Aluminium aerial shot.

props.synopsis: Bell Bay Aluminium has told staff the company faces a "significant risk" after negotiations for a new power deal stalled, jeopardising its future.

title.children: Major Tasmania aluminium smelter delivers 'unsettling news' to staff

image.altText: She stands in the main street and wears a jumper with a bird on it

props.synopsis: Rural residents in Tasmania's north hope a recent council decision will spell the end for a developer wanting to build almost 300 homes.

title.children: Tasmanian village pushes back against 'commuter belt' 263-home project

image.altText: A large white and yellow ship with cranes and lifeboats on the side.

props.synopsis: Two years after the RSV Nuyina was banned from going under Hobart's Tasman Bridge to refuel, the Australian Antarctic Division has formally ditched the possibility of trying to overturn the decision.

title.children: Icebreaker's costly bridge ban won't be reassessed

image.altText: Kerry Forrest standing on the street.

props.synopsis: In the three years that 65-year-old Kerry Forrest has been applying for positions, she has faced repeated rejection. She thinks it is time employers consider older workers more favourably.

title.children: 'I'm 65. That's what's different': Kerry has never had trouble finding work — until now

image.altText: CCTV video of man about to attack blonde woman on street.

props.synopsis: Emma Van Der Hoek had only just moved to London from Sydney when her phone was stolen. She was inspired to do something about it.

title.children: In the world's 'phone theft capital', one Aussie decides to fight back

image.altText: close up of russian soldiers shouting the national anthem

props.synopsis: The Russian president views the prospect of an army returning en masse as a potential risk he wants carefully managed to avoid destabilising society, three sources close to the Kremlin said.

title.children: Russia's 180,000 convict soldiers are causing concern for Putin

image.altText: Four khaki military trucks with red stars carry large missiles.

props.synopsis: The United States is spending billions of dollars muscling up across its Pacific Island military outposts, but locals fear their peaceful islands will become a target.

title.children: Is the US military build-up on these islands inviting China's missiles?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese (4)

props.synopsis: The prime minister has congratulated the US president for helping clinch a peace deal with Israel and Hamas to bring the conflict in Gaza to an end. Follow live.

title.children: PM congratulates Donald Trump for clinching Gaza peace deal

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Anthony Albanese congratulates US president for Gaza peace deal
Foreign Minister Penny Wong welcomes Israeli cabinet's approval of Gaza peace plan
Nicolette Boele says Labor isn't consulting enough on proposed super tax changes

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Jim Chalmers QT

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says his request for Treasury to examine a controversial proposal to lift taxes on some superannuation balances is "nothing unusual", rejecting claims he is planning to rewrite it.

title.children: PM denies going over Chalmers' head to revisit superannuation tax

image.altText: Text messages are collaged over the protest on the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

props.synopsis: Documents obtained by the ABC reveal internal discussions within the NSW government did not align with the external NSW Police messaging that the march could have been "catastrophic".

title.children: Inside the NSW government chat group as the Harbour Bridge Gaza march unfolded

image.altText: A close up shot of a man with white hair wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The former military lawyer was sentenced to five years and eight months in jail after sharing classified material with journalists in a case that has raised debate about whistleblower laws.

title.children: David McBride loses last-ditch effort to overturn conviction

image.altText: police on motorcycles drive toward a black police cordon

props.synopsis: Three people are detained after an "improvised device" is found at the home of one of the suspects in an investigation into terrorist activities.

title.children: Planned terror attack on Belgium's prime minister foiled by police

image.altText: Kate Middleton speaking and gesturing with her hands, wearing a green suit.

props.synopsis: In a joint essay with a Harvard Medical School professor, Princess Kate says the young generation may be the most digitally connected but is "simultaneously being more isolated".

title.children: Princess of Wales warns screen time feeds 'epidemic of disconnection'

image.altText: Charlie Curnow pumps his right fist during Carlton's AFL win over Essendon.

props.synopsis: Day five of the AFL trade period is off with a bang as Carlton receives a first official bid for Charlie Curnow, as the fallout continues from St Kilda's backflip on Leek Aleer. Follow live.

title.children: Pies star secures move as Blues and Lions play hardball in trade talks

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Bulldogs confident of securing a Connor Budarick deal
Brisbane Lions digging their heels in on Callum Ah Chee deal
Deal Done: Brody Mihocek has been traded to Melbourne

image.altText: boy looking away from the cameara with ABC hat on

props.synopsis: Hayden Eastbury lives with fragile X syndrome. He dreams of working for the ABC one day and has made it his mission to visit them all.

title.children: Meet Hayden Eastbury, the 17-year-old visiting every ABC bureau in Australia

image.altText: Two leaders at a podium

props.synopsis: The landmark agreement commits both countries to "meet the common danger" in the event of an armed attack on either. With that, questions have been raised about Australia's role if the conflict in West Papua escalates.

title.children: Indonesia urges respect for its sovereignty after Australia-PNG defence treaty

image.altText: A neon Synergy sign inside the company's Perth office.

props.synopsis: More than 170,000 customers have been overcharged a total of $40 million by WA's state-owned energy retailer Synergy since 2009, as its chief executive apologises.

title.children: Synergy apologises after overcharging customers $40 million in power bills

image.altText: A close shot of Brereton, who is sitting in the offices of the new national anti--corruption commission

props.synopsis: Paul Brereton and Labor politicians had previously stated he had stepped away from the body and resigned as assistant inspector-general of the ADF prior to taking on the top integrity job.

title.children: Corruption watchdog head 'consulted' for ADF inspector general 11 times

image.altText: A young person with serious but confident expression stands in green parklands in black beanie, t-shirt with graphics.

props.synopsis: Alliyah's decision to talk about their abuse was a brave act that exposed the red flags that weren't caught along the way — and they hope it helps others.

title.children: Why Alliyah is identifying themselves as a victim-survivor

image.altText: A statue of a woman with a city in the background and a full moon above her head

props.synopsis: It's that time of the week again. Test your news knowledge to see how much you remember for the week that was.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A viral gaffe, supermoon shots and vintage cars

image.altText: a profile of Ferras

props.synopsis: A former financial adviser involved in placing thousands of clients into the First Guardian Master Fund says he was given clearance by superannuation trustee Diversa to do so after the trustee initially flagged compliance concerns.

title.children: First Guardian financial adviser says he relied on super trustees

image.altText: A middle-aged black woman stands behind a podium in front of an American flag.

props.synopsis: New York Attorney General Letitia James, a longtime foe of US President Donald Trump, is indicted for bank fraud.

title.children: Letitia James, NY attorney general and Trump foe, indicted for bank fraud

image.altText: Capt Dave Holt, pictured with his son, William in a cockpit of a plane.

props.synopsis: A bid to raise the retirement age for pilots has been grounded, with some experts warning the decision could worsen flight delays, cause cancellations and increase airfares.

title.children: International pilots grounded at 65: What it means for travellers

image.altText: A woman wearing glasses standing on a rural property.

props.synopsis: Christine Stasch was planning to sell her family farm and retire further north. Now, she is fighting for compensation after discovering PFAS contamination on her property.

title.children: Landowner says PFAS contamination knocked $400,000 off property value

image.altText: Police escort a hooded man in handcuffs outside of a home

props.synopsis: Strike Force Flodine is investigating a network of alleged "contract criminals" hired by organised crime groups, and their use of staged vehicles or "kill cars" in Sydney.

title.children: Three alleged 'contract criminals' charged in Sydney 'kill car' blitz

image.altText: Shadow attorney-general, Julian Leeser, speaking with ABC Radio National Breakfast on October 9, 2025.

props.synopsis: Crossbenchers are joining forces to condemn the government's FOI bill, calling for its withdrawal and an independent inquiry. Will the Coalition stand for transparency?

title.children: Will the Liberals hold firm in the fight over freedom of information?

image.altText: A medium sized green sea turtle lies in sand with seaweed around it.

props.synopsis: A walker says Adelaide Zoo's care for an injured sea turtle he rescued from Moana beach is a small sign of hope amid the destruction of South Australia's algal bloom.

title.children: 'It was clearly in need of help': Sea turtle rescued from Moana beach

image.altText: A short woman with auburn hair is surrounded by men walking and looking serene

props.synopsis: Husamettin Dogan, 44, was the only one to have maintained his appeal after the first trial last year of 51 men, including Gisele Pelicot's husband, in the case of mass sexual abuse that shocked France and the world.

title.children: Jail term increased for man who appealed Gisele Pelicot rape conviction

image.altText: A man wearing black posing for a photo.

props.synopsis: Deep underground in an old gold mine in regional Victoria, scientists enter a worldwide race to understand the composition of dark matter.

title.children: Inside the experiment that could change our understanding of the universe

image.altText: Unidentified male using laptop

props.synopsis: The spread of child abuse material in Australia has come under renewed focus following high-profile incidents of childcare workers abusing toddlers, and a push by the Coalition to introduce mandatory minimum prison sentences for child exploitation offences.

title.children: AFP powers to combat child abuse 'difficult to fathom' but needed, experts say

image.altText: Roxy Aila is a Brisbane yoga instructor.

props.synopsis: A new national report by Beyond Blue has revealed loneliness and social isolation has reached new heights, with 46 per cent of respondents listing it as a bigger mental health stressor than financial hardship.

title.children: Loneliness a bigger mental health stressor than money for some Australians

image.altText: Cricketer Nadine de Klerk raises her arms in the air, with a cricket bat, celebrating a victory

props.synopsis: South Africa defeats co-hosts India by three wickets in the group stage of the Women's Cricket World Cup.

title.children: Australia remains on top in World Cup after India sink to 'special innings'

image.altText: A woman holding skis and wearing a helmet in the snow.

props.synopsis: It takes a combination of precision and bravery to ski down the snowy mountains. Georgia Gunew does it all with limited vision, her guide and a "pop-star" style headset.

title.children: Steep and icy slopes no barrier for legally-blind skier
